alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 11:12AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Rain and snow band moving through northern Nevada... A band of rain and snow will move through the state from west to east through the late afternoon and early evening hours. Precipitation could start out as rain in some valleys before quickly turning to snow as slightly colder air moves in as the day progresses. Brief heavy snow and some areas of blowing snow are possible which could cause roadways to deteriorate with rapid accumulation of snow. 1 to 2 inches of snow are expected with heavier amounts along passes and higher elevation roadways. This includes portions of I-80 east of Winnemucca to Wendover as well as SR-225, portions of US-93 and SR-227. Precipitation will diminish late this afternoon into the evening hours along with the potential for refreezing of roadway moisture overnight. Weather conditions will improve tonight into Wednesday as the storm system exits the region. Motorists should remain alert to quickly changing weather and road conditions, and reduce speeds over snow covered roadways. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
